description: Lucy Williamson examines France's struggle to deal with the painful legacy of empire.
title: Colonial abuses haunt France's racism debate
title_page: Colonial abuses haunt France's racism debate - BBC News
maintext: Inspired by scenes of demonstrators across the Channel in Bristol throwing the statue of Edward Colston into the city's river, some here are now calling for Colbert to be unseated from his prominent position. He also has a room named after him inside the assembly building.
